# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line) + 1 + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line = isempty(current_line) ? word : "$current_line $word"
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing elit"
println(wrap_string(text, 10))
```

This function takes a string and a maximum width, then breaks lines such that no line exceeds the specified width. In the example provided, the text will be wrapped into lines with the specified `text_width` of 10.
